nub.core.constraint

Class Constraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • nub.core.constraint.Constraint
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AxisPlaneConstraint

    public abstract class Constraint
extends java.lang.Object
    An interface class for Node constraints. This interface API aims to conform that of the great libQGLViewer Constraint.

    This class defines the interface for the constraint that can be applied to a Node to limit its motion. Use Node.setConstraint(Constraint) to associate a Constraint to a Node (default is a null Node.constraint().

        public Constraint()

    • Method Detail

      • constrainTranslation

        public Vector constrainTranslation(Vector translation,
                                   Node node)
        Filters the translation applied to the Node. This default implementation is empty (no filtering).

        Overload this method in your own Constraint class to define a new translation constraint. node is the Node to which is applied the translation. You should refrain from directly changing its value in the constraint. Use its Node.position() and update the translation accordingly instead.

        translation is expressed in the local Node coordinate system. Use Node.worldDisplacement(Vector) to express it in the world coordinate system if needed.

      • constrainRotation

        public Quaternion constrainRotation(Quaternion rotation,
                                    Node node)
        Filters the rotation applied to the node. This default implementation is empty (no filtering).

        Overload this method in your own Constraint class to define a new rotation constraint. See constrainTranslation(Vector, Node) for details.

        Use Node.worldDisplacement(Vector) on the rotation Quaternion.axis() to express rotation in the world coordinate system if needed.
